channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Derek Jeter (Finally) Snags a Buyer for His New York Castle
item.description: The Yankees legend initially put the compound on the market in 2018 for $14.25 million. This time, the asking price was $6.3 million.

item.title: A Hungarian Rapper’s Bandwagon Gets an Unlikely New Rider
item.description: Azahriah, who has rapped about the joy of cannabis, has shot to fame in Hungary. That may explain why he has been applauded by the country’s conservative leader, Viktor Orban.

item.title: Notorious conspiracy theorist Alex Jones' assets will be sold to pay a $1.5 billion debt to families of the Sandy Hook massacre victims
item.description: The court-ordered consequence is the result of Jones' defamatory claims that the shooting, which claimed the lives of 20 children and six teachers, was a "hoax" portrayed by actors.

item.title: It’s Donald Trump’s 78th Birthday. He Isn’t Happy About It.
item.description: As he vies to become the oldest person to be elected president of the United States, former President Donald J. Trump said this birthday was one he wanted to ignore.

item.title: Israeli Defense Chief Rebuffs French Effort to End Israel-Hezbollah Fighting
item.description: The United States, France and other mediators have sought for months to reach an agreement that would stop the tit-for-tat missile strikes over Israel’s border with Lebanon.

item.title: Hugging Face CEO says he hears from 10 AI founders a week who want to sell their startups
item.description: “This year, in particular, it has increased quite a lot,” the CEO said.

item.title: Supreme Court Rejects Trump-Era Ban on Gun Bump Stocks
item.description: The devices allow semiautomatic guns to fire more rapidly. They were banned after one of the deadliest mass shootings in modern U.S. history, at a Las Vegas concert in 2017.

item.title: War Veterans and Family Testify at Al Qaeda Commander’s War Crimes Tribunal
item.description: Victims of insurgent attacks in wartime Afghanistan described their loss to a jury at Guantánamo Bay to give a human face to a written guilty plea.

item.title: Longevity investor Bryan Johnson hosted Kim Kardashian and Andrew Huberman at a ‘Don’t Die Dinner,' where they discussed their own mortality
item.description: What do these influencers have in common? A night of nutty pudding.

item.title: A Retired Army Colonel’s Obituary Shares a Secret: ‘I Was Gay All My Life’
item.description: Edward Thomas Ryan, who died at 85, wrote that he was “afraid of being ostracized.” The revelation set off a wave of online tributes.

item.title: South Africa Re-elects Ramaphosa, but Coalition Is Fragile
item.description: A new government led by the African National Congress gave Cyril Ramaphosa another term as president, though he faces challenges in Parliament.

item.title: Jensen Huang made Nvidia a $3 trillion juggernaut. But the path to success was filled with ‘despair’ and ‘torture’
item.description: At a Fortune conference in 2018, the tech CEO said “there’s no point in starting a company unless you want to make a meaningful contribution to society.”

item.title: Judge Orders Sale of Alex Jones’s Personal Assets but Keeps Infowars in Business
item.description: The ruling will allow the conspiracy theorist to continue broadcasting on Infowars, while the Sandy Hook families pursue payment of $1.4 billion in defamation damages.

item.title: Another Summer to Remember? For Germany: So Far, So Great.
item.description: A 5-1 thrashing of Scotland in the opening game of Euro 2024 was a good omen for a host nation in search of one.

item.title: FTC chair Lina Khan plans to go after Big Tech’s ‘mob boss’ instead of ‘the henchmen at the bottom’—targeting AI giants OpenAI, Microsoft, and Nvidia
item.description: “Where do we see players that are systematically driving these illegal behaviors?” Khan asked at a conference this week.
